title: Compositional Tuning of PtZn Nanoparticles via Heat Treatment for Propane Dehydrogenation
content: The catalytic dehydrogenation of propane to propylene is one of critical processes in the petrochemical industry, driving the need for both efficient and selective catalysts. Pt-based nanoalloy catalysts, e.g., Pt- Cu, Zn, Fe, Ga, In, Sn, Co and La, have emerged as promising candidates due to their superior catalytic properties and tunable electronic and geometric structures [1, 2]. The precise composition of these nanocatalysts is crucial for optimizing their performance, as it directly influences their catalytic activity, selectivity, and stability. Our preliminary work on industry important PtSn/Al2O3 nanocatalysts revealed the presence of compositional variations within individual particles [3], further highlighting the importance of understanding compositional dynamics of nanoalloys. However, the in-situ compositional analysis of these nanoalloys under real reaction conditions remain inadequately explored.
